Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Phylloseptin-L1 (PLS-L1; Medusin-AC; UCLL1c; Leu-rich; natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals; XXA)
Sequence Information.Source: Hylomantis lemur(Hylidae: Phyllomedusinae, South America; also skin secretion, red-eyed leaf frog,Agalychnis callidryas, Central America

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Phylloseptin-L1 was active against S. aureus (MIC 8 uM). This peptide also inhibited growth of B. dendrobatidis zoospores at concentrations above 25 uM with complete inhibition at 100 uM.Toxicity:  Phylloseptin-L1 was approximately equipotent against both HepG2 cells (LC50 35 uM) and erythrocytes (LC50 40 uM).Discovery:Xi X et al(2013) identified the same peptide in a different frog from Central America. Their peptide was active against S. aureus (MIC 8 mg/L) and C. albicans (MIC 32 ug/mL).Toxicity: Hemolytic 80% at 128 ug/mL (HC50 ~70 ug/ml), moderate hemolytic. Found in multiple species. Updated 3/15/2013; 7/2021 GW
Literature Information.Author: Conlon JM, Woodhams DC, Raza H, Coquet L, Leprince J, Jouenne T, Vaudry H, Rollins-Smith LA.2007
Literature Information.Title: Peptides with differential cytolytic activity from skin secretions of the lemur leaf frog Hylomantis lemur (Hylidae: Phyllomedusinae).
